newsitem.title: GREECE: Ten thousand Albanians in Greece cross border to vote.
newsitem.headline: Ten thousand Albanians in Greece cross border to vote.

text.p: About 10,000 Albanian immigrants living in Greece have crossed back to Albania in buses to vote in Sunday's poll but others are too afraid of crime to return, officials said on Saturday.
"From an estimated 300,000 Albanians living here only about 10,000 have gone home to vote. There is much fear because of the armed gangs mainly in the south," a senior police officer told Reuters.
Thousands of people have been killed and scores of properties were looted by armed gangs operating freely in the southern part of the country for the past four months.
Buses carrying the voters were escorted to final destinations by armoured vehicles of the 7,000-strong multinational force in Albania after crossing the Kakavia border post.
Greek authorities have said they will allow the voters to return to Greece whether they have visas or not.
